intro: Lavoisiera rundeliana, commonly known as the Rundel's lavoisiera, is a rare and striking plant native to the Andean highlands of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes where conditions are cool and dry. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, delicate flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
